result.execSummary:
The defendant Cody J. Patterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Expose Child to Harmful Descriptions [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.11(2)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence he might be serving.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence he might be serving.

miscConds.notes:
Pay costs. 
  If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Obtain and maintain fulltime employment, go to school fulltime or a combination thereof.
Psychological assessment and comply with treatment recommendations, if there are any.

Not have any contact, direct or indirect, with victim or victims family. 
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.

Attend and complete parenting classes. 
Attend and comply with sex offender treatment, if deemed appropriate. 
Engage in any other counseling deemed appropriate by Dept of Corrections. 
Sign all necessary release of informations so the agent can monitor treatment. 
Submit DNA sample if not already done so. 
Be assessed by the Portage House as to appropriateness for placement in that program. If accepted, comply with all the requirements of the Portage House, until he is successfully discharged.
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations, if there are any.

records.addlTxt: 03-06-17: Revoked - Sentenced to Prison
Atty McFarland

Defendant Cody J. Patterson in court with attorney Karl Alexander Schmidt. Defendant Cody J. Patterson in custody. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
2:07 p.m.  Court calls the case. 
State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Court and both counsel have received the PSI.  
Atty Molepske has no corrections or additions. 
Atty Schmidt has reviewed the PSI with his client and states amendments to the Court. Doesn't believe they will have time to do the amendments and the sentencing arguments today.  Has 8 amendments and will continue today. 
Atty Molepske makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Schmidt makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Court questions Atty Schmidt re: defendant's current custody status.
Atty Schmidt responds. Defendant is on ES hold.  If he is not incarcerated today, there will be an ATR.  If he is incarcerated, then he will likely be revoked. Defendant has been incarcerated since March 26, 2015. 
Court questions if parties agree the defendant was on a signature bond so there is no pre-trial credit. 
Atty Schmidt makes arguments for 1 day credit. 
Defendant makes statements to the Court. 

BY THE COURT: 
Count 1: 
Serve 5 years prison with 3 years initial confinement followed by 2 years extended supervision, consecutive to any other sentence he might be serving.
1 day credit -STAYED-
Placed on probation for a period of 3 years:
Not have any contact, direct or indirect,with victim or victims family.
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations, if there are any. 
Psychological assessment and comply with treatment recommendations, if there are any. 
Attend and complete parenting classes. 
Attend and comply with sex offender treatment, if deemed appropriate. 
Engage in any other counseling deemed appropriate by Dept of Corrections. 
Sign all necessary release of informations so the agent can monitor treatment. 
Pay costs. 
(No DNA surcharge)
Submit DNA sample if not already done so.
Obtain and maintain fulltime employment, go to school fulltime or a combination thereof.
Maintain absoltue sobriety.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Be assessed by the Portage House as to appropriateness for placement in that program.  If accepted, comply with all of the requirements of the Portage House, until he is successfully discharged. 

Court questions parties re: program eligibility. 
Atty Schmidt doesn't believe he qualifies. 
BY THE COURT:  Defendant is not eligible for the programs. 
Court provides the defendant with a copy of the determinate sentence. 
Both parties retain their copies of the PSI, confidentially in their files.
Sentencing hearing at 06-02-2015 02:00 pm
Email correspondence
from K. Schmidt
from L. Weiss at DCC
Telephone scheduling conference at 04-27-2015 02:00 pm
Sentencing hearing at 04-10-2015 10:45 am

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on April 10, 2015 at 10:45 am.

Defendant Cody J. Patterson in court with attorney Karl Alexander Schmidt. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

11:40 a.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Molepske states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 1 - No contest
Count 2 - DRI

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).
Victim notification had been given by the State but does not appear at the hearing today.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty of Count 1 and Count 2 is DRI.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Sentencing to be set for another date as will be requesting a record review.
Send copy of minutes to the Department of Corrections as record review requested and they are to submit a 1-2 page record review by April 3, 2015.
Bond and conditions of bond continued  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 10, 2015 at 10:45 am.
Plea hearing on March 3, 2015 at 11:15 am.
Plea hearing on January 16, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Pre-trial conference on January 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Cody J. Patterson in court with attorney Karl A. Schmidt. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

BY THE COURT:  Bond Continued. 

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  S.A.A.R or other minor children under the age of 18 or Ga Nel (mother of juvenile) or be within 1000 feet of their residence or their employment

Defendant Cody J. Patterson in court, in custody. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

1:19 p.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Molepske states the appearances.
Atty Molepske states that a detainer had been put on the defendant and transferred to Portage County.
Court questions the defendant if he had received a copy of the criminal complaint; defendant had not but states he is aware of the charges.
Defendant has indicated that he has contacted the public defender for representation.
Court reviews the charges with the defendant as indicated on the criminal complaint.
Defendant wishes to make a statement regarding the facts stated and does so on the record.
Defendant is informed that anything he states can be used against him by the Court.
Atty Molepske states the conditions of bond on the record and is recommending a cash bond.
Defendant is requesting a high signature bond as he does not have the cash being recommended by the State.
Court questions the defendant.
Court questions the defendant as to how long he is on extended supervison; defendant indicates 3 years.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Initial appearance scheduled for November 3, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
